Title: S. Korea 'closely' monitoring possibility of N. Korea sending tro...
Description: The defense ministry said Wednesday it is 'closely' monitoring for signs of North Korea possibly sending troops to support Russia in its war against Ukraine, following media reports of Russia forming a battalion of North Koreans.

Title: Singapore fighter jets escort Air India flight after bomb threat
Description: Singapore's air force mobilized two fighter jets late on Tuesday in response to a bomb threat on an Air India Express flight bound for the city-state, its defense minister said.

Title: Harris mocks Trump after rally turns into bizarre dance-a-thon
Description: Kamala Harris spent much of Tuesday questioning Donald Trump's mental state and fitness for office after the 78-year-old Republican's latest televised town hall veered into a surreal, impromptu music session.

Title: Deepening Canada-India standoff seen as short-term boost for Modi...
Description: The prime ministers of India and Canada could benefit politically in the short term from the unprecedented expulsion of top diplomats from each country, analysts said on Tuesday.

Title: US tells Israel to improve Gaza humanitarian situation or risk mi...
Description: The United States has told Israel it must take steps in the next month to improve the humanitarian situation in Gaza or face potential restrictions on U.S. military aid, U.S. officials said, in the strongest such warning since Israel's war with Hamas began a year ago.

Title: US urges N. Korea to stop actions that raise conflict risk after ...
Description: The United State called on North Korea Tuesday to stop actions that would increase the risk of conflict, after Pyongyang blew up roads linked to South Korea in a rancorous removal of land routes once seen as a symbol of inter-Korean cooperation.

Title: N. Korea's state media keeps mum about its explosion of inter-Kor...
Description: North Korea's state media on Wednesday remained silent about its explosion of inter-Korean roads connected to South Korea the previous day.

Title: S. Korea voices regret over Russia siding with N. Korea in drone ...
Description: South Korea voiced 'deep regret' Tuesday after Russia expressed support for North Korea's claim that Seoul flew drones into Pyongyang, and characterized the alleged acts as an infringement of sovereignty and interference in internal affairs.

Title: North Korea blows up parts of inter-Korean roads amid escalating ...
Description: North Korea blew up the northern sections of two inter-Korean roads, Tuesday, in an apparent attempt to sever all ties with South Korea and formalize a hostile, two-state system on the Korean Peninsula.

Title: Google to buy power for AI needs from small modular nuclear react...
Description: Alphabet's Google said on Monday it signed the world's first corporate agreement to buy power from multiple small modular reactors to meet electricity demand for artificial intelligence.

Title: Israel tells US will not hit Iran's nuclear or oil facilities: me...
Description: Israel has assured the White House that a planned retaliatory attack on Iran won't target nuclear or oil facilities, U.S. media reported Monday.

Description: North Korea blew up parts of its roads connected to South Korea on Tuesday, the military said, after vowing to cut off the roads and railways once seen as symbols of inter-Korean cooperation.

Title: China ends war games around Taiwan, but leaves door open to more
Description: China's military vowed to take further action against Taiwan if needed after staging a day of war games on Monday it said were a warning to 'separatist acts' and which drew condemnation from the Taiwanese and U.S. governments.

Title: Pandas are coming': Two new bears depart China for US capital
Description: Two giant pandas departed China for a zoo in the U.S. capital on Monday, a Chinese conservation group said in a statement.

Title: US mulls capping Nvidia AI chips exports to some countries, Bloom...
Description: U.S. officials have discussed limiting sales of advanced AI chips from Nvidia and other American companies on a country-specific basis, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Israel faces fierce, evasive foe in Hezbollah's drones

Title: NASA launches Europa Clipper mission to reach Jupiter moon by 203...
Description: A NASA spacecraft rocketed away Monday on a quest to explore Jupiterâ€™s tantalizing moon Europa and reveal whether its vast hidden ocean might hold the keys to life.

Title: Pyongyang slams UN special rapporteur's report on N. Korea's huma...
Description: North Korea on Tuesday denounced Elizabeth Salmon, the U.N. special rapporteur for North Korean human rights, for submitting a report on North Korea's human rights abuses to the U.N. General Assembly, calling her a 'puppet and top-class servant' of the United States.

Title: Russia urges S. Korea to avoid provocations amid N. Korea's drone...

Description: Chinese and European automakers went head-to-head at the Paris car show on Monday, with tensions running high as the EU gears up to impose hefty import tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles and the industry struggles with weak demand.

Title: In Denmark, 50 well-preserved Viking Age skeletons have been unea...
Description: In a village in central Denmark, archeologists made a landmark discovery that could hold important clues to the Viking era: a burial ground, containing some 50 'exceptionally well-preserved' skeletons.

Title: Russian prosecutor demands 3 years, 3 months jail for French rese...
Description: A Russian prosecutor on Monday requested a sentence of three years and three months in a penal colony for a French researcher accused of breaching a 'foreign agent' law.

Title: N. Korean leader's sister accuses S. Korean military of flying dr...
Description: Kim Yo-jong, the influential sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, accused the South Korean military on Monday of sending unmanned drones carrying leaflets over Pyongyang in recent days.

Title: Trio wins economics Nobel for work on wealth inequality
Description: The Nobel prize in economics was awarded on Monday to Turkish-American Daron Acemoglu and British-Americans Simon Johnson and James Robinson for research into wealth inequality between nations.

Title: China sanctions Taiwan businessman Robert Tsao, lawmaker for 'sep...

Title: China's September inflation misses market expectation despite mon...
Description: China's monetary policy easing did not spike inflation last month, with both consumer and producer price growth falling short of expectations and deflationary pressures continuing to bite.

Title: Israeli tanks deepen their push into the northern Gaza Strip
Description: Israeli forces widened their raid into northern Gaza and tanks reached the north edge of Gaza City, pounding some districts of the Sheikh Radwan neighborhood and forcing many families to leave their homes, residents said.

Title: Harris, Trump seek advantage in knife-edge election battle

Title: TSMC third-quarter profit seen jumping 40% on strong AI chip dema...
Description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, the main producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, is expected to report a 40 percent leap in third-quarter profit on Thursday thanks to soaring demand.

Title: N. Korea appears to be preparing for explosions on roads connecte...
Description: North Korea appears to be preparing to carry out explosions at roads connected to South Korea, South Korea's military said Monday.

Title: US to send anti-missile system and troops to Israel, Pentagon say...
Description: The United States said on Sunday it will send U.S. troops to Israel along with an advanced U.S. anti-missile system, in a highly unusual deployment meant to bolster the country's air defenses following missile attacks by Iran. U.S. President Joe Biden said the move was meant 'to defend Israel,' which is weighing an expected retaliation against Iran after Tehran fired more than 180 missiles at Israel on Oct. 1.

Title: China starts new round of war games near Taiwan, offers no end da...
Description: China's military started a new round of war games near Taiwan on Monday, saying it was a warning to the 'separatist acts of Taiwan independence forces,' and offered no date for when they may conclude, drawing condemnation from Taipei's government.

Title: N. Korea slams US envoy's remarks critical of N. Korean human rig...

Title: North Korea says ordered artillery corps near border to fully pre...
Description: North Korea said Sunday it has ordered its artillery corps near the border with South Korea to fully prepare to shoot after the North threatened a 'horrible disaster' over the alleged flight of drones over its capital.

Title: Tackling Korean language education for children of North Korean d...
Description: A North Korean defector in his 30s recently attempted to cross the heavily-fortified border between North and South Korea. The man, who fled to South Korea in 2011, stole a bus to drive across the Tongil Bridge in Paju, located south of the heavily fortified demilitarized zone (DMZ). Investigators revealed that he had been working as a construction worker in the South and was feeling homesick.

Title: Blinken to raise NK-Russia cooperation issue at ASEAN gatherings ...

Title: N. Korea amends socialist constitution at parliamentary meeting w...

Title: US continues to monitor N. Korea's support for Russia: Pentagon
Description: The United States continues to monitor North Korea's support for Russia, a Pentagon spokesperson said Tuesday, following a news report that six North Korean military officers were killed in a Ukrainian missile strike on Russian-occupied territory near Donetsk last week.

Title: Trump secretly sent COVID tests to Putin: Bob Woodward book

Title: N. Korea appoints new ambassador to Switzerland

Title: Hezbollah steps up rocket fire as Israel sends more troops into L...

The Israeli military said it sent more ground troops into southern Lebanon and that a senior Hezbollah commander was killed in an airstrike.

Title: Teenage NK defector shares horrific story of life in reclusive re...

Title: Harris holds slight edge nationally over Trump: poll

Title: Taiwan president is escalating tensions, China says ahead of key ...

Title: N. Korea sends more trash balloons toward S. Korea: JCS
Description: North Korea launched balloons likely carrying trash toward South Korea early Friday, the South's military said, just three days after a similar launch.

Title: Floridians flee looming catastrophe as Hurricane Milton approache...

Title: N. Korean man crosses into S. Korea in 3rd defection in 2 months

Title: Musk's X gets OK to resume service in Brazil after bending to top...

Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes, who had been locked in a months-long feud with Musk, gave X the green light to resume operations in Latin America's largest country effective immediately.

Title: N. Korea claims US exploits S. Korea's security uneasiness for ne...

Title: Nobel Prize in chemistry awarded to David Baker, Demis Hassabis a...
Description: The Nobel Prize in chemistry was awarded Wednesday to David Baker, Demis Hassabis and John Jumper for their work with proteins, the building blocks of life.

Title: NK says S. Korea sent unmanned drones over Pyongyang
Description: North Korea said Friday that South Korea has sent unmanned drones over Pyongyang three times since last week, calling the move a military provocation and a violation of its sovereignty.

Title: Pilot dies aboard Turkish Airlines flight, forcing emergency land...
Description: A Turkish Airlines jetliner headed from Seattle to Istanbul made an emergency landing in New York on Wednesday after the captain died on board, an airline official said.

Title: Russian ambassador to N. Korea hosts reception to mark diplomatic...
Description: The Russian ambassador to North Korea has hosted a reception to reaffirm bilateral ties ahead of the 76th anniversary of diplomatic relations, Pyongyang's state media reported Saturday.

Title: Ukraine claims strike on depot storing N. Korea ammunition
Description: Kyiv said Wednesday it had struck a Russian arms depot in the border region of Bryansk that was storing hardware and ammo including munitions supplied to Moscow by North Korea.

Title: N. Korea sends 20 more trash balloons toward S. Korea: JCS

Title: N. Korean media report claims that Seoul sent drones over Pyongya...
Description: North Korea's news media reported Saturday the reclusive regime's claim that South Korea sent unmanned drones carrying anti-North propaganda leaflets over Pyongyang three times this month.

Title: Would ending Hong Kong liquor tax, delaying shisha ban and extend...
Description: Hong Kong's bar sector has urged authorities to scrap the liquor tax, postpone a ban on flavored cigarettes and extend the operating hours of MTR train services to revitalize the industry amid a growing trend of residents travelling to mainland China to spend.

Title: DPK blasts military for not confirming NK's claim Seoul sent dron...
Description: The main opposition Democratic Party of Korea (DPK) criticized the military Saturday for saying it could not confirm North Korea's claim that South Korea had sent unmanned drones over Pyongyang.

Title: US warns Israel not to repeat Gaza destruction in Lebanon
Description: The United States urged its ally Israel to avoid Gaza-like military action in Lebanon, after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said it could face 'destruction' like the Palestinian territory.

Title: S. Korea warns N. Korea will see end of regime if it harms its pe...

Title: Former China deputy central bank head gets suspended death senten...

Title: Some of N. Korea's trash balloons equipped with GPS transmitters:...
Description: Some of the balloons floated by North Korea to dump trash across South Korea have been equipped with GPS transmitters, South Korea's military said Sunday.

Title: Reports of NK soldiers in Ukraine may show Russia's 'profound' de...
Description: Reports of North Korean soldiers killed in a recent Ukrainian missile attack, if true, would show Russia's 'profound' desperation to secure outside support for its war in Ukraine, a State Department spokesperson said Thursday.

Title: NK stokes anti-South Korea sentiment with drone incursion claim

Title: Germany will send more weapons to Israel soon, Scholz says
Description: Germany will supply more weapons to Israel soon, Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Thursday, after a significant drop in deliveries this year prompted opposition accusations that Berlin deliberately delayed the exports.

Title: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Japanese organization of atomic bomb...
Description: The Nobel Peace Prize was awarded Friday to Nihon Hidankyo, a Japanese organization of survivors of the U.S. atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, for its activism against nuclear weapons.

Title: Residents clean up and figure out what's next after Hurricane Mil...
Description: Florida residents repaired damage from Hurricane Milton and tried to figure out what to do next Friday after the storm smashed through coastal communities and tore homes to pieces, flooded streets and spawned a barrage of deadly tornadoes.

Title: Obama targets male voters in Pennsylvania campaign swing for Kama...
Description: Former U.S. President Barack Obama made a passionate case against Donald Trump on Thursday during a campaign rally in Pennsylvania in which he appealed directly to men to reject Trump's bravado and back Vice President Kamala Harris.

Title: Russia's Putin cements ties with Iranian president in bilateral t...
Description: Russia's Vladimir Putin held talks with Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian on Friday in Turkmenistan, where the two leaders hailed their countries growing economic ties and similar views on world affairs, an entente viewed with concern by the U.S.

Title: Tesla's robotaxi event was long on Musk promises, but investors w...
Description: For a businessman who perpetually struggles with broken promises, Elon Musk gave himself quite a to-do list Thursday night at Tesla's long-awaited Hollywood unveiling of its driverless robotaxis.

Title: China says it will 'significantly increase' debt to revive econom...
Description: China said on Saturday it will 'significantly increase' government debt issuance to offer subsidies to people with low incomes, support the property market and replenish state banks' capital as it pushes to revive sputtering economic growth.

Title: Germany's Scholz announces more military aid as Zelenskiy visits ...
Description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz announced Friday a 1.4 billion euro ($1.53 billion) military aid package for Ukraine by the end of 2024, telling President Volodymyr Zelenskiyy that it was a signal to Russia that the West would not stop supporting Kyiv.

Title: China accuses detained Foxconn workers of suspected bribery
Description: The Chinese government said Friday that employees of Taiwan's Foxconn, the world's largest iPhone assembler, are being investigated for allegedly taking bribes and embezzlement, after Taiwan reported their detention.

Title: Boeing to cut 17,000 jobs, delay first 777X jet as strike hits fi...
Description: Boeing will cut 17,000 jobs - 10 percent of its global workforce - delay first deliveries of its 777X jet by a year and record $5 billion in losses in the third quarter, as the U.S. planemaker continues to spiral during a month-long strike.

Title: China threatens Taiwan with more trade measures after denouncing ...
Description: China is studying further trade measures against Taiwan, Beijing's Ministry of Commerce said Saturday, two days after it denounced a speech by Taiwan President Lai Ching-te.

Title: Alexei Navalny wrote he knew he would die in prison in new memoir
Description: Russian dissident Alexei Navalny, who was President Vladimir Putin's top political opponent before his death in February, believed he would die in prison, according to his posthumous memoir which will be released Oct. 22.

Title: With medical report, Harris plays health card against Trump
Description: Democratic White House candidate Kamala Harris is in 'excellent health' and fit for the presidency, according to a medical report published by the White House Saturday, as she challenged rival Donald Trump to publish his own health records.

Title: Heavy Israeli bombardment in northern Gaza as UN peacekeepers in ...
Description: Palestinians in northern Gaza described heavy Israeli bombardment Saturday in the hours after airstrikes killed at least 22 people, as Israel warned people there and in southern Lebanon to get out of the way of offensives against the Hamas and Hezbollah militant groups.

Title: Nobel Peace Prize winners warn of rising risk of nuclear war
Description: Leaders of the group of atomic bomb survivors awarded the Nobel Peace Prize warned on Saturday that the risk of nuclear war was rising, renewing their call to abolish nuclear weapons.

Title: China invites EU team for more talks to hammer out EV tariffs dis...
Description: China has invited an EU team to visit for further talks on the bloc's tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, despite the failure of nearly three weeks of negotiations, according to the Chinese Ministry of Commerce.

Title: Pope urged at LGBT meeting to reverse church ban on gender-affirm...
Description: Pope Francis faced calls to overturn the Catholic Church's ban on gender-affirming care for transgender people on Saturday when he held talks with LGBTQ activists at the Vatican.

Title: Poland's leader plans to suspend right to asylum as country faces...
Description: Poland's leader said Saturday that he plans to temporarily suspend the right to asylum as part of a new migration policy, pointing to its alleged abuse by eastern neighbor Belarus and Russia.

Title: Taiwan on alert as China aircraft carrier group detected
Description: Taiwan said it was 'on alert' as it detected a Chinese aircraft carrier group to its south on Sunday, days after the United States warned Beijing against taking 'provocative' actions on the self-ruled island.

Title: Netanyahu tells UN chief to move peacekeepers in Lebanon 'out of ...
Description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday called on the UN chief to move UN peacekeepers deployed in southern Lebanon out of 'harmâ€™s way.'

Title: Chinese premier could inaugurate Beijing-funded airport in Pakist...
Description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang could inaugurate operations at a Chinese-funded airport in Pakistan's Balochistan province during his visit to the country in the coming week, information minister Attaullah Tarar told reporters on Sunday.

Title: Tens of thousands flee Nigeria floods
Description: Two major rivers have flooded across central Nigeria displacing tens of thousands of people, the Red Cross told AFP.

Title: Trump tested limits on using military at home. If elected again, ...
Description: During his first term as president, Donald Trump tested the limits of how he could use the military to achieve policy goals. If given a second term, the Republican and his allies are preparing to go much further, reimagining the military as an all-powerful tool to deploy on U.S. soil.

Title: SpaceX catches giant Starship booster in fifth flight test
Description: SpaceX on Sunday launched its fifth Starship test flight from Texas and returned the rocket's towering first stage booster back to land for the first time, achieving a novel recovery method involving large metal arms.

Title: Mechanical SpaceX arms catch Starship rocket booster back at laun...
Description: SpaceX pulled off its boldest test flight yet of the enormous Starship rocket on Sunday, catching the returning booster back at the launch pad with mechanical arms.
